Front Page

Neighbor Launches Crowdfund for "Community Harmony Through Full Plate Armor"

By Mirella Thimblewick, Founder, Treasurer, and Unpaid Emotional Labor Department

After seven months of "friendly reminders" about quiet hours, I have opened a dignified crowdfunding campaign: fund armor for every resident so no one can shrug loudly ever again.

"If your hinge squeaks after 9 p.m., that's not rustic charm. That's acoustic aggression."

My campaign, Mail Before You Tail, equips the courtyard with chainmail aprons, visor etiquette cards, and one velvet hammer for ceremonial tapping. It is not punitive. It is decorative accountability.

Darren from 4C called this "a lot." Darren once reheated fish at midnight while testing a blender called The Cyclone Beast 9000. We are past "a lot." We are in a new chapter called "preventative steel."

Every pledge includes my weekly report, Sound You Made / Sound You Claimed You Didn't Make. Data has never been this personal.

Tonight's fundraising banquet remains black tie with pauldrons. RSVP by raven or text; both are legally binding.
